entry.title: The 118 Job
entry.summary:
Author: lifewithferg

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,022Chapters: 9/12Kudos: 22

Summary: Maddie exhales deeply, sinking back into the chair as the screens all flip to black, Karen having turned off the feed. She slowly moves to the table, very aware of the eyes on her. Sitting down, she looks at Bobby and Athena, who are both looking at her with a shared expression of mischief. “What?” She asks innocently, “I like making sure they’re safe, is all.” “Maddie, that was the easiest job they’ve both done in months. They could have done it blindfolded, with their hands tied behind their backs in broad daylight and have been fine,” Athena’s quick response is sharp, but teasing. _________ Or: The 118 are a team who operate on the wrong side of the law. Heists and chaos are all part of the fun until the stakes are raised when one of their own becomes leverage.

entry.title: bring it on home to me
entry.summary:
Author: oklahoma

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 89,879Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 337

Summary: “That’s the fifth time I’ve hit my hip on the table,” he says, rubbing his side as if it’ll stop the sting. “Your kitchen is too small.”“I know.” Eddie grabs for the butterknife and starts the precarious process of raking away the black streak without fucking up his masterpiece beneath. “We’ll look for a house with a bigger kitchen on Zillow after the bake sale.”Buck makes a funny noise, like a raccoon caught in the trash. “What?”-Eddie buys a new house, battles with the homeowner's association, omits the truth, almost dies, and during the process realizes yeah, he's a little bit in love with his best friend.

entry.title: So Wrong...So Right
entry.summary:
Author: ReggietheChickenWhisperer

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,757Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Rewritten starting at the competition scene with Tommy and Buck.Buck stands up for himself and Eddie against Tommy. Even though Buck has come a long way, he still struggles when he's alone, even more so once he breaks up with Tommy for a second time and is left alone in Eddie's house. But, even though standing up against Tommy felt so right, something will go so horribly wrong.Eddie is in Texas, has been for months. He finally has Chris again, which feels so right. But something is missing, something is wrong. He's stuck working as an Uber and seeing all his friends and family in LA through a phone screen.What will it take for things to finally be right for Buck and Eddie again?

entry.title: Alternate Route
entry.summary:
Author: popcorn_squirrel

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,145Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: “Pull over.” Eddie doesn't mean to say it so loudly, but it startles Buck anyway. “W–what?” Buck asks, glancing over at him with wide eyes. “Pull over, Buck,” Eddie repeats, taking care to say it more gently this time. Buck shakes his head a few too many times, eyes returning to being glued on the road, and hands keeping their death grip on the steering wheel. “N–no, I’m f–fine,” he stutters out with a tight smile that looks more like a grimace.  “No, you’re not fine,” Eddie pushes back, “and that’s okay. Just pull over for a bit.” or; Buck and Eddie get stuck in a storm on their drive home, and a downed tree forces them to spend a night at a tiny inn. Fluffvember Day 18: Inn

entry.title: You're My Baby, Say It To Me. (I Bet On Losing Dogs)
entry.summary:
Author: Roselover0

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,459Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 63

Summary: After the firetruck incident that left Buck off work with a leg full of metal rods, Buck spent his days with nothing to do and no one to really see. With his friends all working and his day consisting of normal civilian activities, he was lonely. So why not try fostering a kid? This is the story of girl-dad Evan Buckley taking care of a girl who really needs someone. Enjoy!The title is lyrics from "I Bet On Losing Dogs" by MitskiInstagram Account is: https://www.instagram.com/unknown_theys/Spotify Playlist for the fic: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/6ktg7bEh1vv9WYH8IGzV69Updates every Thursday

entry.title: my empty cup on your nightstand (my bones in your teeth)
entry.summary:
Author: cheolbobaa

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,780Chapters: 3/7Kudos: 106

Summary: Buck's eyes widen to an almost comical degree as he comes to the conclusion of two things in real time—one, this bartender is about to out him to everyone here because he doesn't have the good sense to put two and two together and two, Buck absolutely cannot, not in a million fucking years, have his friends and loved ones find out he's a blood-sucking creature of the night because of one very frantic bartenders mix-up with a some blood and a goddamn virgin Bloody Mary.So he does the only sensible thing to do and spits his drink out—right in Ravi's face.In front of everyone at the table."Oh my god." Buck thinks he vaguely hears Chim and Hen whisper as he winces. Bobby looks at Buck like he’s grown a second head.Bucks too afraid to turn and see Eddies reaction.   ———or - evan buckleys desperate struggle to avoid the chasm of love that has Eddies name engraved in it, even if maddie and chim are doing their absolute best to throw him into it, be it willingly or with Buck kicking and screaming the whole way there.

entry.title: Under the Wrong Mistletoe (Or the Right One)
entry.summary:
Author: aeternus_diamant

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,952Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 24

Summary: The annual Nash-Grant Christmas party is supposed to be calm, cozy, and completely free of disasters—but this is the 118, so naturally everything goes sideways. Chimney’s eggnog is a biochemical threat, Christopher is secretly running a mistletoe operation, and half the team is absolutely convinced Buck and Eddie just need one nudge (or twenty) to finally kiss already. Between Secret Santa chaos, twinkle lights, and family meddling that should honestly be illegal, Buck and Eddie keep orbiting closer and closer—until a very strategic mistletoe forces the truth into the open. It’s warm, messy, romantic, a little embarrassing, and very them.A Christmas miracle, 118 style.

entry.title: Seven Minutes in Hell
entry.summary:
Author: tarjtaejin

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,848Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 25

Summary: When a routine structural collapse turns into a full tunnel cave-in, Buck and Eddie find themselves pinned beneath broken concrete, twisted metal, and seven minutes of uncertainty. In the dark, with radios out, help still digging toward them, and Eddie dangerously injured, they do the only thing they can—talk to stay awake. Between shallow breaths and shaking hands, truths begin to slip through the cracks: promises, fears, and the aching realization that home has never been a place—it’s been a person, right beside them all along. Above ground, the 118 digs like hell to get them out. Below it, Buck holds Eddie together—with his hands, with his voice, and with something he’s never dared to name. When they finally emerge from the wreckage—bloodied, shaken, but alive—they’re holding onto each other. And no one is surprised.

entry.title: The Space Between Us (Is Killing Me)
entry.summary:
Author: HourglassDiaz

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,239Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 28

Summary: Ever since Buck moved out and Ravi helped him settle into his new house, Eddie’s been spiraling. He’s not used to the distance. Not from Buck. Not after El Paso, not after the FaceTimes and late-night calls and soft words that felt like something more. Now Buck’s spending all his time with Ravi—at work, on weekends, at home. And Eddie is left with Hen and half-finished thoughts. When Eddie shows up uninvited at Buck’s new place and finds Ravi there, too—barefoot and too familiar—it all explodes. The jealousy, the grief, the confusion. Buck was his. Or at least he thought so. A slow unraveling of two idiots in love, told through tension, late-night arguments, Ravi’s raised eyebrows, and Chris’s knowing sighs. OR Eddie's jealousy finally reaches the boiling point and explodes, and he confronts Buck about it and they do their classic dumbassery about it.. until they don’t.

entry.title: You’re the Sun to Me
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,381Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 200

Summary: “Speaking of…you got any idea what this lunch is about? She was pretty vague when she called.” Buck paused, then he shook his head, a small frown pulling between his brows. “Nope. Not a clue.” “But you’re worried,” Eddie guessed. Buck gave a half-shrug, trying for casual, though his hand lingered at Tori’s side like the contact grounded him. “Maddie doesn’t usually do vague. If she says she wants to talk, she wants to talk.” Tori let out a babble just then, saving him from saying more. Buck leaned down, pressing a kiss to the top of her head before scooping her into his arms. “Guess we’ll find out soon enough.” Eddie studied him for a moment. Buck’s answering smile was soft but a little distracted, like his mind was already skipping ahead to lunch. And Eddie couldn’t shake the feeling that Maddie’s words would upend the equilibrium they’d worked so hard to hold. Or, After years of chaos, they’ve built a life full of love and family, but a hidden secret from Buck’s past threatens their fragile peace. When the past collides with the present, even the happiest home feels uncertain.

entry.title: Piece By Piece (English Version)
entry.summary:
Author: Pookiebrin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,023Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 86

Summary: Buck had finally understood... it had taken him 3 months, 3 months of silences and angry looks, of orders given coldly and endless lists of tasks at the station, of people leaving when he sat down at the table, of conversations stopping when he arrived.3 months but he had finally understood: Station 118 did not forgive and those he had fought for had turned their backs on him.3 months but it had become clear to him: he was not welcome there and that was not his family, it never had been. And now all that was left was to let go. But a call and a girl who reminds him too much of himself could be the solution to the cold in his life and his heart.
